name: Bukit Sadok
features: A historical hilltop site where Iban warrior Rentap defended against British colonial forces. Offers panoramic views of the Saribas plains and South China Sea.
address: Approximately 3 hours' hike from Betong town

name: Fort Lily
features: Built in 1858 by James Brooke, this belian timber fort served as a defense post and is now being converted into a museum showcasing Iban cultural artifacts.
address: Jalan Datuk Patinggi Udin, Betong, Sarawak, Malaysia

name: Matop Longhouse, Sungai Paku
features: A traditional 28-door Iban longhouse where visitors can experience ancestral culture including skull viewing and tuak tasting.
address: 30 km from Betong along the Paku River

name: Maludam National Park
features: Peat swamp forest covering 432 sq km, home to Proboscis Monkeys and hornbills. Rich biodiversity for nature lovers.

name: Pantai Tanjung Kembang
features: A peaceful beach for relaxation and scenic coastal views.

name: Masjid Jamek Saratok
features: Main mosque in Saratok, known for community activities and worship.
